result.execSummary:
The defendant Deearce L. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deearce L. Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deearce L. Jones was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Deearce L. Jones was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Deearce L. Jones was found guilty of Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: To be paid while on probation.
To be paid while on probation.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  (DOC-2156)  Def. has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program, and the court shall modify the bifurcated sentence.  The portion of confinement time not served will be added to extended supervision time.  Total length of sentence will not be changed.  DOC shall determine the number of days converted from confinement to extended supervision based on actual release date.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 3 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions Consecutive to any other sentence.  See conditions
Count 4 - DE is sentenced to 30 days in the KCJ forthwith and Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs to be paid during probation period.
Count 5 -   DE is sentenced to 6 years in the WSP; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  Sentence is consecutive to Count 4.  DE is eligible for CIP & SAP.
DE shall be given credit for 116 days for time already served.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Atty Lassiter has been unable to go over the PSI with the def. at KCDC.  Sentencing reset for 7/7/15 at 9:00.
by agent Elizabeth Lemcke
